RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 1 1/16M Turf CR: 73. Maiden Claiming Purse 18000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500. In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and One-Sixteenth on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONSTERONTHEMIDWAY tucked in behind the leading pair and rated off those tracking along the rail saving ground, found room inside at the top of the stretch, took the lead racing in the two path at that juncture, drew clear under urging. ELECTRIC CHARGE was ridden along from the break but lacking significant early speed, shifted in and saved ground through the first turn, continued along the rail through the far turn and put to a drive coming to the top of the stretch, came out in mid-stretch, was no match for the winner but secured the place. RUSSIAN STANDARD was lightly bumped at the start, stalked the early pace two to three wide, moved to challenge putting a nose in front at the five- and one-half, continued to press the leader through the far turn, was carried out numerous paths coming to the top of the stretch as that rival bore out, kept on in the lane to secure show honors, pulled up on the gallop out, was vanned off. LITTLE STEVEN went straight to the lead to set the pace from inside, was headed and challenged near the five- and one-half pole, continued to face pressure through the far turn, bore out badly leaving that bend, came up empty. ARMAVIR shifted in early, saved ground, was asked for more coming to the five-sixteenths, ran on without threatening. CHERRY ORCHARD bumped a rival at the start, stalked from outside a foe three to four wide off the leading pair, was carried out eight deep by those two turning for home, ran on. MARCHING ORDERS was wrangled back in the early going racing outside three to four wide, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Steven
ENTRY.OWNER: Northfork Farm Horses LLC McLane Chuck and Smith Brian
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace, challenged 5-1/2, bore out badly 1/4, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Russian Standard
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2-3w, bid 5-1/2, carried out 1/4, kept on for show, van

ENTRY.NAME: Cherry Orchard
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump foe brk, stalk outside 3-4w, carried 8wd 1/4, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Monsteronthemidway
ENTRY.COMMENT: tucked in, rated inside, led upper, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Electric Charge
ENTRY.COMMENT: ridden early, saved ground, came out str, no match, got 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Marching Orders
ENTRY.OWNER: Warchol Thoroughbreds LLC and Burke Mark
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back 3-4w, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Armavir
ENTRY.COMMENT: shifted in, inside, ask 5/16, no menace

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 39000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 19 Allowed 2 lbs. (Clai ming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLOW TORCH bumped the outer rival after the start, tracked from inside runners, steadied and was shuffled past the half, put to urging on the turn saving ground, struck the lead in mid-stretch with an inside bid, drew clear. FAITHFUL RULER quickly moved clear to set the pace, raced off the rail into the turn, drifted out through the stretch, was overtaken by mid-stretch and outkicked but held second. PLAUSIBLE DENILE bumped the outside rival then was bumped by the inside foe at the start, raced between runners early just off the leader, shifted out on the turn coming into upper stretch four wide, ran on for show. DASH TO THE CASH was bumped at the start, lacked early speed, saved ground on the turn, ran on mildly. TIMEHASCOME stalked from outside going three wide on the turn, lacked needed late kick.

ENTRY.NAME: Faithful Ruler
ENTRY.COMMENT: quickly clear, pace, off rail, drifted out str, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Blow Torch
ENTRY.OWNER: JL Racing LLC Kane Mark E and Rosin Coty W
ENTRY.COMMENT: stdy'd & shuffled past 1/2, inside bid, led mid-str, cleared

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Taylor Brothers Properties LLC, PollockFarms & Patrick H.

ENTRY.NAME: Plausible Denile
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumps brk, btw early, shifted out, 4wd 3/8, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Dash to the Cash
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk, no speed, saved ground, mildly

ENTRY.NAME: Timehascome
ENTRY.OWNER: Martin Christopher and Hernandez Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside, 3wd turn, no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances ).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PINBALLER forced the pace, dueled outside a foe two to three wide into the turn, began to edge away from that one and forged clear in mid-stretch then held safe. UNCLE NICK was forwardly-positioned early, dropped back leaving the backstretch and into the turn, saved ground inside on that bend, came out four wide in upper stretch, was gaining too late. TEA AFTER BALLET raced last but one near but off the rail through the turn, came out a bit in the stretch, kicked on to just get up for show honors. SANTINO'S FANTASY was well-placed early, engaged the eventual winner dueling inside that one up the backstretch and on the turn, weakened in the stretch and lost show honors late. FAITHFUL KING switched outside the leaders in the early going, pursued from the three to four path on the turn, failed to rally. IRONMAN RICHIE pursued the pace from outside, went three to five wide drifting out a bit while weakening into the stretch, was eased late and walked off. TEA WITH LEMON broke a step slowly, lacked early speed, was outpaced.

ENTRY.NAME: Santino's Fantasy
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside winner late bkstr & turn, weakened, lost show

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Nick
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back inside early turn, came out 4wd upper, gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Faithful King
ENTRY.COMMENT: switched out, 3-4path turn, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Pinballer
ENTRY.OWNER: Dundalk 5 LLC Wesley F Herek Racing Stable LLC and Ernie T Poulos Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, duel 2-3w, forged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Ironman Richie
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside pursuit 3-5w, eased, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Tea With Lemon
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, no speed, outpaced

ENTRY.NAME: Tea After Ballet
ENTRY.COMMENT: near inside, came out str, up for show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS OR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since June 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Claiming races for $10,000 or less n ot considered in eligibility and allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SONO GRATO was shuffled back after the start, allowed to settle into stride racing well off the inside at the back, advanced outside foes circling five wide on the far turn and taking the lead about the five-sixteenths, drew off in upper stretch, lasted. EMPTY HOLSTER settled at the back inside, advanced on the far turn racing off the rail, waited briefly past the five-sixteenths, found room between runners six wide in upper stretch, finished up strongly gaining on the winner but too late. SOUPER FORTUNE set the pace racing just off the rail, was overtaken late on the far turn, switched outside the new leader in upper- to mid-stretch, had no extra. STORM BORN tracked from inside, came out at the top of the stretch, ran on. MEATLOAF'S CHANCE was caught four wide on the first turn moving forward outside foes and shifting in to be three deep racing just off the leader, was within range three wide on the far turn, fanned seven wide into upper stretch, lacked the needed late kick. FLYING SAMURAI settled racing off the inside in behind the leading quartet, went four wide on the far turn almost within striking distance, failed to menace late. MOVE ON OVER was forwardly-positioned three wide early, dropped back and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Born
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside, came out str, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Souper Fortune
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace, off rail, switched out mid-str, no extra

ENTRY.NAME: Move On Over
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly, 3w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Samurai
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, off rail, 4wd 2nd turn, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Sono Grato
ENTRY.OWNER: Cox John E Basler Tom Pohl Dennis and Pohl Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled after brk, off inside, circled 5w, clear, lasted

ENTRY.NAME: Empty Holster
ENTRY.OWNER: Martinez Ralph and Martin Paul E
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, brief wait past 5/16, gaining 6w, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Meatloaf's Chance
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4wd 1st turn, 3wd 2nd turn & in range, 7wd str, no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 5 5F Turf CR: 95. Claiming Purse 26000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since June 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Claiming races for $16,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at Five Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAND HIDEAWAY settled mid-pack racing three wide on the turn, came out six wide in upper stretch, drove past late. IAN GLASS bumped the inside rival at the start, was among the early leaders then settled just off that pair racing outside, stalked four wide into the turn, kicked on to take the lead a sixteenth from home but was nailed late. MALPAIS soon led facing pressure from outside foes setting the pace while just off the rail, weakened in late stretch but held show. REAL NEWS shifted in, saved ground on the turn advancing to within range in upper stretch, came out late while evening out. STALLONE was bumped and squeezed back at the start, shifted in racing off the pace inside saving ground early on the turn, angled six wide coming out of that bend, ran on mildly late. ONE PUTT RICHIE raced outside off the leaders mostly four wide on the turn and swinging seven deep into upper stretch, ran on mildly but needed more. NILES CHANNEL lacked early speed racing at the back, swung eight wide and improved. SIERRA HOTEL raced inside in the back half of the field early, was never near enough to threaten. UPBEAT MELODY pressed then chased the pacesetter from outside three wide, came up empty. AZRAEL broke a bit awkwardly, failed to menace. PER THE HORSERACING INTEGRITY AND WELFARE UNIT, GRAND HIDEAWAY HAS BEEN DQ'D DUE TO A POSITIVE TEST.

ENTRY.NAME: Malpais
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace, off rail, weakened late, HELD SHOW

ENTRY.NAME: Sierra Hotel
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside early, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Upbeat Melody
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed, chased pace, 3w, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Real News
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside advance upper, came out late, evened out

ENTRY.NAME: Stallone
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd, sqz'd brk, inside turn, angled 6wd into str, mildly late

ENTRY.NAME: Ian Glass
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump foe brk, stalked 4w, led 1/16-late, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Niles Channel
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, swung 8w, improved

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Grand Hideaway
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid-pack, 3wd turn, came out 6wd upper, drove past late

ENTRY.NAME: Azrael
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit awkward brk, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: One Putt Richie
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside, 4-7w, mildly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IT'S MAGIC was bumped at the start, settled off the pace shifting in, saved ground on the turn advancing on the leaders, came out five wide at three-sixteenths, lugged a bit in the lane but surged past late. ANGEL EXPRESS moved forward inside and soon to the front, set a pressured pace racing just off the rail, was clear into upper stretch but outfinished. COMMISSIONER GULCH shifted in racing off the leading pair in behind up the backstretch, advanced on or just off the rail on the turn, came out a bit in the stretch, ran on evenly late. BORDER STAR raced outside foes mid-pack three to four deep on the turn, came out a bit turning for home, drifted in through upper stretch, ran on. GUSTAVI was reluctant to be mounted, acted up behind the gate, broke just a hair slowly then was encouraged forward between runners, pressed the pace three wide into and on the turn, dropped back and faded while not being persevered with through the final furlong. GOLD OAK chased off the leaders going between rivals into the turn, continued two to three deep on that bend shifting out a bit turning for home, was forced in by a drifting rival in upper stretch, faded. FLYING COMET stumbled into a rival at the start nearly losing the rider, raced at the back and off the inside, was never near enough to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Angel Express
ENTRY.OWNER: H Third Equine LLC M T of Lemont LLC and Phillip Sagan Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: forward, pace, off rail, clear, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Gustavi
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious behind gate, forward btw, pressed 3w, faded stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Commissioner Gulch
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: shifted in, advance inside-2p turn, came out bit str, evenly late

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Oak
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 2-3w turn, forced in upper str, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Border Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside, 3-4w, drifted in upper

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Comet
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled into foe brk, off inside, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: It's Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk, inside turn, came out 5wd 3/16, lugged str, surged past

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 106. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 41000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $50,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or o ver since June 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Claiming races for $25,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOTARY was well back of the leading trio racing off the fence, made a sweeping move outside four deep on the far turn taking the lead by the quarter pole and drifting in a bit, continued to drift in and lightly brushed the inside foe late, was kept busy to the wire. BUCK MOON bobbled ever so slightly at the start but went straight to the front, set a lively pace inside, dispatched the two nearest pursuers on the far turn but was overtaken by another rival at the quarter pole, fought on stubbornly, was lightly brushed late and was outkicked. SILVER QUARTERS settled well back, rallied in tandem with and inside a rival in the stretch to get up for show. MILLARD'S SMILE settled well back, raced off the inside, was outfinished for show while rallying in the lane. EMPIRE BUILDER stalked three to four wide off the leading pair, was within range till upper stretch, faltered and faded. TREASURY pressed the pace up the backstretch, began to drop back entering the far turn, switched outside foes to the three to four path about the seven-sixteenths, faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Millard's Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, off inside, outfinished for show

ENTRY.NAME: Notary
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back of trio, swept 4wd 2nd turn, led 1/4, kept busy

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Quarters
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, up for show inside

ENTRY.NAME: Buck Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: very slight bobble brk, lively pace inside, headed 1/4, stubborn

ENTRY.NAME: Treasury
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Robert K and Haselton Britt
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed, switched out 3-4w 7/16, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Empire Builder
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3-4w, faltered str, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 8 1M Turf CR: 81. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since June 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Claiming races for $12,500 or less not considered in est imating allowances). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM'S REFLECTION raced two to three wide in the back half of the field early, was a little boxed in heading up the backstretch into the far turn, shifted six wide coming out of that bend for room, drove past and cleared. LAWMAKER stalked two to three wide early, eased back off the pace and switched out late up the backstretch, moved four then five then six wide on the far turn taking the lead at the top of the stretch, drifted in a bit, was outkicked but held second. KINGSBURRY ATTACK settled outside foes toward the rear racing three to four wide, continued outside foes on the far turn, moved out a bit for the drive and gained late. BRODY'S FLY was well-placed in behind the leaders tracking while saving ground near the rail, made a mild bid inside at the top of the stretch but had no extra. CLASSOFSIXTYSEVEN unhurriedly brought up the rear shifting nearer the rail, was still well back turning for home, guided out seven deep, belatedly ran on. PAYNT BY LETTERS was hard to load, exchanged a bump at the start, was two to three wide just off the leaders through the first turn, continued near but off the fence on the far turn gaining on the leaders coming past the quarter pole and within range, lacked the needed late kick. STRIKE PRICE saved ground racing inside, went evenly. BAILEYS RUN set the pace racing inside on or just off the rail, drifted out leaving the far turn, faded. I'M YOUR CAPTAIN exchanged a bump at the start, stalked from outside three to four wide early, advanced on the leader midway up the backstretch to prompt that one, who then got away, moved again while three wide on the far turn pressing while being carried out five wide, tired in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Brody's Fly
ENTRY.COMMENT: ceded lead, tracked inside, mild bid top str, no extra

ENTRY.NAME: Strike Price
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside, saved ground, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Storm's Reflection
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w early, boxed in bit bkstr, shifted 6wd into str, drove past

ENTRY.NAME: Baileys Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace, insd-2path, drifted out 1/4, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Classofsixtyseven
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, shifted in, came out 7wd upper, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Lawmaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2-3w, switched out, 4-6w 2nd turn, led upper, drift in

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Your Captain
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump brk, stalked 3-4w, 3-5w 2nd turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Paynt by Letters
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard to load, bump brk, 2-3w turns, in range, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Kingsburry Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w turns, late gain
